thread.title: S&T Bank Hosts Financial Crimes Seminar At Rustic Lodge
thread.title_full: S&T Bank Hosts Financial Crimes Seminar At Rustic Lodge

author: admin
title: S&T Bank Hosts Financial Crimes Seminar At Rustic Lodge
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: S&T Bank 
INDIANA, Pa., Oct. 23, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- S&T Bank, a full-service financial institution with assets of $6.2 billion, branch locations in 16 southwestern and southcentral Pennsylvania counties, and loan production offices in northeast and central Ohio, and western New York, announced today the Bank is hosting a financial crimes seminar featuring representatives of the FBI and Crowe Horwath, on Thursday, November 5, 2015 at the Rustic Lodge beginning at 9:30 a.m. 
http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20150424/201506LOGO 
With the number of financial crimes on the rise, S&T Bank will partner with the FBI and Crowe Horwath to discuss business fraud and recommended prevention strategies, as well as monitoring solutions that local businesses can leverage to ultimately reduce risk. The seminar will also provide insights to business resolutions that can be enacted should fraud occur. 
"We believe it's our responsibility to continue to assist our local business customers in protecting their companies against a wide variety of threats," said S&T Bank senior executive vice president and chief operating officer David P. Ruddock. "By hosting this seminar we hope to contribute to their financial well-being." 
The event, which will conclude at 11:30 a.m., is open to the public and will feature an FBI Special Agent as well as Crowe Horwath's Technology Risk Manager Ken Major. S&T Bank encourages local businesses interested in learning more to join us at the Rustic Lodge, located at 2199 Oakland Avenue, Indiana, Pa. 15701. 
To learn more and to RSVP for the event please visit S&T Bank here . 
About S&T Bancorp, Inc. and S&T Bank:S&T Bancorp, Inc. is a $6.2 billion bank holding company that is headquartered in Indiana, Pa. and trades on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol STBA. Its principal subsidiary, S&T Bank, was established in 1902 and operates in 16 counties across southwestern and southcentral Pennsylvania, with loan production offices in northeast and central Ohio, and western New York. For more information visit www.stbancorp.com , www.stbank.com , or call 800.325.2265. 
To view the original version on PR Newswire, visit: http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/st-bank-hosts-financial-crimes-seminar-at-rustic-lodge-300165454.html 
SOURCE S&T Bank
